vulnerability.label: V.PLAINTEXT
vulnerability.name: Use of clear text protocols
vulnerability.description: The use of clear text protocols and the transmission of business and control data unencrypted over insecure communication channels (e.g. FTP, TELNET)

vulnerability.label: V.SERVICES
vulnerability.name: Unnecessary services enabled on system components
vulnerability.description: The presence of unnecessary system services on key ICS components and subsystems that may be exploited to negatively impact on system security (e.g. sendmail, finger services).

vulnerability.label: V.REMOTE
vulnerability.name: Remote access vulnerabilities
vulnerability.description: Uncontrolled external access to the corporate network (e.g. through the Internet) allowing unauthorizzed entry to the interconnected ICS network. Also includes vulnerabilities introduced through poor VPN configuration, exposed wireless access points, uncontrolled modem (e.g. through networked faxes) and weak remote user authentication technique.

vulnerability.label: V.ARCHITECTURE
vulnerability.name: Poor system architecture design leading to weaknesses in system security posture
vulnerability.description: Business and operational requirements impacting on the effectiveness of deployed or planned security measures to protect the confidentiality, integrity and availability of the ICS and its components. Poor security architecture may also lead to the bypass and tamper of ICS security functions.

vulnerability.label: V.DEVELOPMENT
vulnerability.name: Poor system development practices leading to weaknesses in system implementation
vulnerability.description: Lack of quality procedures (e.g. configuration management, quality testing) leading to errors in system implementation and third party products such as buffer overflows and errors in control algorithms.

vulnerability.label: V.NOPOLICIES
vulnerability.name: Inadequate system security policies, plans and procedures
vulnerability.description: Lack of formal system policies, plans and procedures (e.g. weak password policies, no incident response plans, irregular compliance audits, poor configuration management policies and procedures, poor system auditing practices, backup procedures etc).

vulnerability.label: V.SPOF
vulnerability.name: Single Points of Failure
vulnerability.description: Poor security architecture design leading to one or more single points of failure in the ICS and resulting in system unavailability.

vulnerability.label: V.NOTRAINING
vulnerability.name: Inadequate user training
vulnerability.description: Inadequate user training on system security issues leading to poor user security awareness.

vulnerability.label: V.3RDPARTY
vulnerability.name: Unauthorised access to ICS via 3rd party networks
vulnerability.description: Unauthorised user access to the ICS or its components via a 3rd party network connection.

vulnerability.label: V.NORISK
vulnerability.name: Lack of risk assessment
vulnerability.description: Inadequate risk assessment activities performed on critical assets leading to a poor understanding of the security posture of the ICS and the security controls needed to counter security risks to the organisation.

threat.label: ATTACK.SNIFF
threat.name: Unauthorised traffic analysis
threat.description: Packet capture tool, keystroke logger etc.

threat.label: ATTACK.REPLAY
threat.name: Unauthorised replay of captured traffic
threat.description: Packet capture tool, keystroke logger etc.

threat.label: ATTACK.SPOOF
threat.name: Impersonating an authorised user
threat.description: Exploitation of weak user authentication mechanism.

threat.label: ATTACK.DOS
threat.name: Overloading the network
threat.description: Denial of service attack from the internet causing system downtime.

threat.label: ATTACK.ERROR
threat.name: Operator error
threat.description: ICS system operator error causing security breach.

threat.label: ATTACK.SOCIAL
threat.name: Social engineering of authorised users
threat.description: Unsolicited contact with employee with intent of discovering user credentials or acquiring sensitive information.

threat.label: ATTACK.VIRUS
threat.name: Virus infection of ICS system components
threat.description: Virus propagation via email system or Internet download content (e.g. Trojan)

threat.label: ATTACK.DESTROY
threat.name: Destruction of ICS control data, business data, or configuration information
threat.description: File deletion on compromised ICS file servers.

threat.label: ATTACK.MODIFY
threat.name: Modification of ICS control data, business data, or configuration information
threat.description: File modification on compromised ICS file servers#Insider/Manipulation

threat.label: ATTACK.BYPASS
threat.name: Bypass of system security functions and mechanisms
threat.description: Modification of ICS configurations of components

threat.label: ATTACK.PHYSICAL
threat.name: Compromise of poorly implemented and/or controlled physical security mechanisms
threat.description: Unauthorised access to physically secured areas housing system assets (e.g. perimeter security breach)

threat.label: ATTACK.NATURE
threat.name: Acts of nature causing system unavailability
threat.description: Environmental occurrences such as earthquake, flood and fire
